page.title: 17 East Fife Football Team
page.content: Bayview Park is the home ground of East Fife our local football team. The pitch was opened in 1903,a lot of the work done voluntarily by fans. It is in good condition,often playable when bad weather closes other pitches. The stadium holds 10000 people.The grandstand, built in 1922 holds 1000. It is needing rebuilt and they may be able to if the government give clubs money to help with new regulations set down after the Bradford City fire disaster when over fifty people died. The teams best days were just before and after the 1939-45 war.In 1938 they were the only 2nd division team to win the Scottish cup.Charlie Fleming,Alan Brown and Henry Morris have played for them and only recently they sold Gordon Durie to Hibs.They have avoided relegation to the 2nd division this year.Well done the Black and Golds!
